author: ressi
post_text: August 8, 2014 at 12:56â€¯PM#1Hi everyone,i wonder if it's possible to use the name of a pool objects e.g presets or effects to label the executer they are stored in.I wrote a macro which asks for 2 color-preset-numbers and stores them into a sequence. Now i want to label the sequence with a specific name because i don't want to have several "col2exec"-Sequences and don't know which color is stored into them.Of course i could use the preset-names instead of the preset-numbers and put them together with "AddUserVar"but it would be great if there is a possibility to do it with numbers.In another macro i store several effects in sequences each for each. So i can go like this:Search for effects i like -> Copy them to 1001 an higher -> Run the macro to get these effects stored in sequences and assign them to executor.I would be glad if someone got an idea for this.thanks a lot,ressi
title: Use Names from Pool Objects in Macros
